sentences.text: Proxy Summary  Linking Pay with Performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: LINKING PAY WITH PERFORMANCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pay for Performance Culture Our executive compensation programs reflect the belief that the amount earned by our executives must, to a significant extent, depend on achieving rigorous Company, business unit and individual performance objectives designed to enhance shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In prior years, we illustrated the correlation between cumulative shareholder returns and Mr. Cutlers compensation over his tenure as CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Given our leadership transition and the distortion in pay that primarily results from the change in the form of our long-term performance based incentive plan as described on page 31, we have modified the pay and performance illustration to show the payouts as a percentage of target under our performance-based annual and long-term incentive programs and total return to shareholders over the last five years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The table clearly illustrates the correlation between pay and the performance we are delivering to our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: areholder Return and Performance-Based Incentive Plan Payouts  There was no payout under the long-term performance-based plan (ESIP) in 2012.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxy Summary  Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We design our executive compensation plans and programs to help us attract, motivate, reward, and retain highly qualified executives who are capable of creating and sustaining value for our shareholders over the long term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We endorse compensation actions that fairly reflect company performance as well as the responsibilities and personal performance of individual executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation Program Highlights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation programs are intended to align the interests of our executives with those of our stakeholders and are structured to reflect best practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Some features of our programs are included in the following chart.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION PRACTICES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What We Do:    What We Dont Do:    Focus on long-term compensation using a balanced portfolio of compensation elements such as cash and equity, and deliver rewards based on sustained performance over time    Stock ownership requirements for executives (6X base salary for CEO)    Shareholder-approved short-term and long-term incentive plans    Incentive plan payout caps in our short- and long-term incentive plans, which prevent unintended windfalls    Compensation recovery policy (clawbacks)    Use of targeted performance metrics to align pay with performance         No employment contracts with any salaried U.S. employees, including named executive officers       No hedging or pledging of our shares       No dividend or dividend equivalent payments on unearned performance-based grants       No use of the same metrics in short- and long-term incentive plans       No repricing of stock options and no discounted stock options       No tax gross-up provisions in change of control agreements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Say On Pay 2016 Advisory Vote and Shareholder Engagement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors is committed to understanding the views of our shareholders by providing an opportunity to endorse our executive compensation through an advisory, non-binding vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, our shareholders approved our executives compensation by a vote of 94%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee will continue to review our compensation programs each year in light of the annual say-on-pay voting results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 1: Election of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors is currently comprised of 13 members, all of whom serve for a term of one year or until a respective successor is elected and has been qualified.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective at the annual general meeting, our board size will be reduced to 12 members as Linda A. Hill has decided not to stand for re-election.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Hill informed the Governance Committee chair that she would not stand for re-election due to scheduling conflicts between her responsibilities as a director and her other commitments such as teaching and other academic responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All nominees are currently Eaton directors who were elected by shareholders at the 2016 annual general meeting, except Dorothy C. Thompson, who was elected by the Board of Directors effective July 29, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If any of the nominees becomes unable or declines to serve, the individuals named as proxies in the enclosed proxy form will have the authority to vote for any substitutes who may be nominated in accordance with our Articles of Association.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, we have no reason to believe that this will occur.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: OUR NOMINEES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Craig Arnold Chairman, Eaton Corporation plc and Chief Executive Officer, Eaton Corporation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Craig Arnold is Chairman of the Company and Chief Executive Officer of Eaton Corporation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Arnold joined Eaton in 2000 as senior vice president and group executive of the Fluid Power Group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He was Vice Chairman and Chief Operating Officer of the Industrial Sector until August 2015 and President and Chief Operating Officer until June 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He currently serves on the boards of Medtronic plc and University Hospitals Health System and is a member of The Business Roundtable and The Business Council.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Arnold serves as a director of The Greater Cleveland Partnership and the United Way of Greater Cleveland, and as an advisory board member of the Salvation Army of Greater Cleveland.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Qualifications: Mr. Arnolds years of senior management and executive leadership experience at Eaton provide important insight into the Company to the benefit of the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Arnold has gained detailed knowledge of Eatons businesses, customers, end markets, sales and marketing, technology innovation and new product development, supply chains, manufacturing operations, talent development, policies and internal functions through his service in a wide range of management roles with the Industrial Sector, and as President and Chief Operating Officer of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, he possesses significant corporate governance knowledge developed by current and past service on the boards of other publicly traded companies, most notably for Medtronic plc, a publicly traded company domiciled in Ireland.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Since 2015 Age 56
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Todd M. Bluedorn Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, Lennox International Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Todd M. Bluedorn is Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Lennox International Inc., a global provider of climate control solutions for heating, air conditioning and refrigeration markets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to joining Lennox International in 2007, Mr. Bluedorn served in numerous senior management positions for United Technologies Corporation since 1995, including President, Americas  Otis Elevator Company; President, North America  Commercial Heating, Ventilation and Air Conditioning for Carrier Corporation; and President, Hamilton Sundstrand Industrial.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He is a director of Texas Instruments Incorporated and a trustee of Washington University in St. Louis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Qualifications: Mr. Bluedorn has executive leadership experience in original equipment and aftermarket business and distributor/dealer-based commercial channels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He also has senior leadership experience with two major industrial corporations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: His experience with industrial companies in responding to dynamic market conditions benefits Eaton as a global manufacturing company with product distribution through numerous commercial channels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Since 2010 Age 53

sentences.text: Christopher M. Connor Retired Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, The Sherwin-Williams Company
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Christopher M. Connor is the retired Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of The Sherwin-Williams Company, a global manufacturer of paint, architectural coatings, industrial finishes and associated supplies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Connor held a number of executive positions at Sherwin-Williams since 1983.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He became Chief Executive Officer in 1999, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer in 2000, and Executive Chairman in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He currently serves on the boards of The Sherwin-Williams Company, University Hospitals Health System, Playhouse Square Foundation and The Rock and Roll Hall of Fame.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Qualifications: As the retired Chairman and former CEO of a Fortune 500 company, Mr. Connor has leadership experience and is thoroughly knowledgeable in marketing, talent development, planning, operational and financial processes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In particular, he has had extensive sales and marketing experience in both direct and distribution channels, and brings broad knowledge of construction, automotive and industrial markets, all areas of strategic importance to Eaton.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: His background and experience with human resources, talent development, compensation and management are of particular benefit to Eaton in his role as Chair of the Compensation and Organization Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: His background and broad experience are of particular benefit to Eaton in his role as Lead Director.

sentences.text: Michael J. Critelli served as Chief Executive and President and a director of Dossia Services Corporation, a personal and population health management systems company, from 2011 until 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Critelli is the retired Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Pitney Bowes Inc., a provider of global mailstream solutions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He served as Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Pitney Bowes from 1997 to 2007 and as Executive Chairman from 2007 to 2008.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Critelli served as a director of ProHealth Physicians, Inc. from 2012 until 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He currently serves as a director of CloudParc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Qualifications: Mr. Critelli has extensive experience in risk management, cybersecurity, industry-wide leadership in transportation, logistics, online and social media marketing and communications issues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HOW NOMINEES ARE CHOSEN
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Nomination Process
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee of the Board, composed entirely of directors who meet the independence standards of the Board of Directors and the New York Stock Exchange, is responsible for overseeing the process of nominating individuals to stand for election as directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee charter is available on our website at http://www.eaton.com/governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee will consider any director candidates recommended by our shareholders, consistent with the process used for all candidates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To learn how to submit a shareholder recommendation, see below under Shareholder Recommendations of Director Candidates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee chair reviews all potential director candidates in consultation with the Chairman, typically with the assistance of a professional search firm retained by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee decides whether to recommend one or more candidates to the Board of Directors for nomination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Candidates who are ultimately nominated by the Board stand for election by the shareholders at the annual general meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Between annual general meetings, nominees may also be elected by the Board itself.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Dorothy C. Thompson was elected by the Board effective July 29, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Thompson was dentified as a director candidate by the Chairman and other Company directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 1:  Election of Directors  Director Independence
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Qualifications and Board Diversity
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to be recommended by the Governance Committee, a candidate must have the following minimum qualifications, as described in the Board of Directors Governance Policies: personal ability, integrity, intelligence, relevant business background, independence, expertise in areas of importance to our objectives, and a commitment to our corporate mission.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Governance Committee looks for individuals with specific qualifications so that the Board as a whole has diversity in experience, international perspective, background, expertise, skills, age, gender and ethnicity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These specific qualifications may vary from year to year, depending upon the composition of the Board at that time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee is responsible for ensuring that director qualifications are met and Board balance and diversity objectives are considered during its review of director candidates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee annually evaluates the extent to which these goals are satisfied as part of its yearly assessment of the skills and experience of each of the current directors using a director skills matrix and a director evaluation process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The director evaluation process includes self-evaluation, peer evaluation and input from the chairs of each Board committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon completion of the skills matrix and the evaluation process, the Governance Committee identifies areas of director knowledge and experience that may benefit the Board in the future and uses that information as part of the director search and nomination effort.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors Governance Policies are available on our website at http://www.eaton.com/governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder Recommendations of Director Candidates
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee will consider director candidates who are recommended to it in writing by any Eaton shareholder who submits a recommendation by following the procedures required under our Articles of Association for nominating director candidates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, any shareholder wishing to recommend an individual as a nominee for election at the 2018 annual general meeting of shareholders should send a signed letter of recommendation to the following address: Eaton Corporation plc, Attention: Company Secretary, Eaton House, 30 Pembroke Road, Dublin 4, Ireland D04 Y0C2.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recommendation letters must be received no earlier than December 17, 2017 and no later than the close of business on January 16, 2018, or if Proposal 3 in this years proxy statement is approved by shareholders at this years annual general meeting, recommendation letters must be received no earlier than November 17, 2017 and no later than the close of business on December 17, 2017, and must include the reasons for the recommendation, the full name and address of each proposed nominee, and a brief biographical history setting forth past and present directorships, past and present positions held, occupations and civic activities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The recommendation letter should be accompanied by a written statement from the proposed nominee consenting to be nominated and, if nominated and elected, to serve as a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any shareholder wishing to recommend an individual as a nominee for election as a director must also describe in writing any financial agreement, arrangement or understanding between the nominee and any party other than the Company relating to such nominees potential service as a director, any compensation or other payment received from any party other than the Company relating to such nominees potential service as a director, and details regarding such agreement, arrangement or understanding and its terms, or of any compensation received.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DIRECTOR INDEPENDENCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors Governance Policies provide that all of our non-employee directors should be independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The listing standards of the New York Stock Exchange state that no director can qualify as independent unless the Board of Directors affirmatively determines that he or she has no material relationship with the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional, and more stringent, standards of independence are required of Audit Committee members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our annual proxy statement discloses the Boards determination as to the independence of the Audit Committee members and of all non-employee directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For our current directors, we describe these determinations here.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As permitted by the New York Stock Exchange listing standards, the Board of Directors has determined that certain categories of relationships between a non-employee director and the Company will be treated as immaterial for purposes of determining a directors independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These categorical standards are included in the Board of Directors independence criteria.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The independence criteria for non-employee directors and members of the Audit Committee are available on our website at http://www.eaton.com/governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because directors independence may be influenced by their use of Company aircraft and other Company-paid transportation, the Board has adopted a policy on this subject.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In their review of director independence, the Board of Directors and its Governance Committee have considered the following circumstances:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors T. Bluedorn, C. Connor, L. Hill, G. Page and D. Thompson serve or have served as officers or employees of companies that had purchases and/or sales of property or services with us during 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In each case, the amounts of the purchases and sales met the Boards categorical standard for immateriality; that is, they were less than the greater of $1 million or 2% of the annual consolidated gross revenues of the directors company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Bluedorn is Chairman and CEO o Lennox International Inc., which purchased approximately $368,000 worth of Eaton products during 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Connor is the retired Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of The Sherwin-Williams Company, which purchased approximately $153,000 worth of Eaton products and sold approximately $898,000 worth of products to Eaton during 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Page is the retired Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Cargill, Incorporated, which purchased approximately $740,000 worth of Eaton products and sold approximately $17,460,000 worth of products to Eaton during 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, Cargill paid approximately $7,967,000 in royalty payments to the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Hill is a director of Harvard Business Publishing, which provided executive training services to Eaton for an aggregate cost of $1,000 during 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Thompson is Chief Executive of Drax Group plc, which sold approximately $203,000 in goods or services to Eaton in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The use of our aircraft and other Company-paid transportation by all non-employee directors is consistent with the Board policy on that subject.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After reviewing the circumstances described above (which are the only relevant circumstances known to the Board of Directors), the Board has affirmatively determined that none of our non-employee directors has a material relationship with the Company other than in his or her capacity as a director, and that each of the following directors qualifies as independent under the Boards independence criteria and the New York Stock Exchange standards: T. Bluedorn, C. Connor, M. Critelli, C. Golden, L. Hill, A. Johnson, D. McCoy, G. Page, S. Pianalto, G. Smith and D. Thompson.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All members of the Audit, Compensation and Organization, Finance and Governance Committees qualify as independent under the standards described above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board also has affirmatively determined that each member of the Audit Committee  D. McCoy, S. Pianalto, G. Page, G. Smith and D. Thompson  meets not only our Boards independence criteria but the special independence standards required by the New York Stock Exchange and the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002 and the related rules adopted by the Securities and Exchange Commission.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Review of Related Person Transactions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors has adopted a written policy to identify and evaluate related person transactions, that is, transactions between us and any of our executive officers, directors, director nominees, 5%-plus security holders or members of their immediate families, or organizations where they or their family members serve as officers or employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board policy calls for the disinterested members of the Boards Governance Committee to conduct an annual review of all such transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the Committees direction, a survey is conducted annually of all transactions involving related persons, and the Committee reviews the results in January or February of each year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee is responsible for determining whether any related person transaction
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) poses a significant risk of impairing, or appearing to impair, the judgment or objectivity of the individuals involved;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) poses a significant risk of impairing, or appearing to impair, the independence of an outside director or director nominee; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) has terms that are less favorable to us than those generally available in the marketplace.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Depending upon the Committees assessment of these risks, the Committee will respond appropriately.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, as required by the rules of the Securities and Exchange Commission, any transactions that are material to a related person are disclosed in our proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As discussed above, the Governance Committee is charged with reviewing issues involving director independence and all related persons transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee and the Board have determined that since the beginning of 2016 the only related person transactions were those described above under the heading Director Independence and that none of our executive officers engaged in any such transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee also concluded that none of the related person transactions posed risks to the Company in any of the areas described above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: overseeing the orientation of new directors and the ongoing education of the Board;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: recommending to the Board compensation of non-employee directors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: administering the Boards policy on director retirements and resignations; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: establishing guidelines and procedures to be used by the directors to evaluate the Boards performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other responsibilities include providing oversight on significant public policy issues with respect to our relationships with shareholders, employees, customers, competitors, suppliers and the communities in which we operate, including such areas as ethics, compliance, environmental, health and safety issues, community relations, government relations, charitable contributions and shareholder relations.

sentences.text: BOARD MEETINGS AND ATTENDANCE AT ANNUAL GENERAL MEETING
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors held four meetings in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of the directors attended at least 90% of the meetings of the Board and the committees on which he or she served.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The average rate of attendance for all directors was 95%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy of the Board of Directors is that all directors should attend the annual general meetings of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the 2016 annual general meeting held April 27, 2016, 13 of the 14 members of the Board at that time were in attendance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BOARD GOVERNANCE POLICIES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board revised the Board of Directors Governance Policies most recently in February 2016, as recommended by the Governance Committee of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The revised Governance Policies are available on our website at http://www.eaton.com/governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EXECUTIVE SESSIONS OF THE NON-EMPLOYEE DIRECTORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Boards policy is that the non-employee directors, all of whom qualify as independent under the criteria of the Board of Directors and the New York Stock Exchange, meet in Executive Session at each regular Board meeting, without the Chairman or other members of management present, to discuss topics they deem appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described more fully in Leadership Structure below, the Lead Director chairs these Executive Sessions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At each meeting of the Audit, Compensation and Organization, Finance and Governance Committees, the Committee members (all of whom qualify as independent) hold an Executive Session, without any members of our management present, to discuss topics they deem appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: LEADERSHIP STRUCTURE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our governance structure follows a successful leadership model under which the Chief Executive Officer of Eaton Corporation also serves as Chairman of the Board of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recognizing that different leadership models may work well for other companies at different times depending upon individual circumstances, we believe that our Company has been well served by the combined Chief Executive Officer and Chairman leadership structure and that this approach has continued to be highly effective with the addition of a Lead Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe we have benefited greatly from having a Chairman who sets the tone and direction for the Company while also having the primary responsibility as Chief Executive Officer for managing Eatons day-to-day operations, and allowing the Board to carry out its strategic, governance, oversight and decision-making responsibilities with the equal involvement of each director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board is composed primarily of independent directors, except for our Chairman, Mr. Arnold, and Mr. Fearon.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Of our 10 non-employee directors, five are currently serving or have served as a chief executive officer of a publicly traded company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit, Compensation and Organization, Finance and Governance Committees are chaired by independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Chairman has benefited from the extensive leadership experience represented on our Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board evaluates the leadership structure annually, and it will continue to do so as circumstances change, including when a new Chief Executive Officer is elected.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In its February 2017 annual evaluation, the Board concluded that the current leadership structure  under which the Chief Executive Officer of Eaton Corporation serves as Chairman of the Board of the Company, our Board committees are chaired by independent directors, and a Lead Director assumes specific responsibilities on behalf of the independent directors  remains the optimal board leadership structure for our Company and our shareholders at the present time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents

sentences.text: Proposal 1:  Election of Directors  Communicating with the Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Lead Director
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Christopher M. Connor, who has served on Eatons Board since 2006, was first elected Lead Director by our independent directors in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Lead Director has specific responsibilities, including chairing meetings of the Board at which the Chairman is not present (including Executive Sessions of the Board), approving the agenda and schedule for Board meetings on behalf of the independent directors, approving information sent to the Board, serving as liaison between the Chairman and the independent directors, and being available for consultation and direct communications with shareholders and other Company stakeholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Lead Director has the authority to call meetings of the independent directors and to retain outside advisors who report directly to the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Lead Directors performance is assessed annually by the Board in a process led by the Chair of the Governance Committee, and the position of Lead Director is elected annually by our independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: OVERSIGHT OF RISK MANAGEMENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management continually monitors the material risks facing the Company, including strategic risk, financial risk, operational risk, and legal and compliance risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has chosen to retain overall responsibility for risk assessment and oversight at the Board level in light of the interrelated nature of the elements of risk, rather than delegating this responsibility to a Board committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board is responsible for overseeing the strategic planning process and reviewing and monitoring managements execution of the corporate and business plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described below, the Board receives assistance from certain of its committees for the identification and monitoring of those risks that are related to the committees areas of focus as described in each committee charter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board and its committees exercise their risk oversight function by carefully evaluating the reports they receive from management and by making inquiries of management with respect to areas of particular interest to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee considers risks related to internal controls, disclosure, financial reporting and legal and compliance matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Among other processes, the Audit Committee meets regularly in closed-door sessions with our internal and external auditors and senior leaders of Eaton Corporation, including the senior members of the Finance function, the Executive Vice President, General Counsel and Secretary, and the Senior Vice President-Global Ethics and Compliance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described more fully in the section entitled Relationship Between Compensation Plans and Risk on page 49, the Compensation and Organization Committee reviews risks associated with the Companys compensation programs to ensure that incentive compensation arrangements for senior executives do not encourage inappropriate risk taking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee considers risks related to corporate governance, such as director independence and related person transactions, and risks associated with the environment, health and safety.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CODE OF ETHICS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have a Code of Ethics that was approved by the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide training globally for all employees on our Code of Ethics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We require that all directors, officers and employees of the Company, our subsidiaries and affiliates, abide by our Code of Ethics, which is available on our website at http://www.eaton.com/governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, we will disclose on our website any waiver of or amendment to our Code of Ethics requiring disclosure under applicable rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMMUNICATING WITH THE BOARD
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors provides a process for shareholders and other interested parties to send communications to the Board, ndividual directors or the non-employee directors as a group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders and other interested parties may send such communications by mail or courier delivery addressed as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Company Secretary Eaton Corporation plc Eaton House 30 Pembroke Road Dublin 4, Ireland D04 Y0C2
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Email messages to the directors may be sent to Board@eaton.com.

sentences.text: Generally, the Company Secretary forwards all such communications to the Lead Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Lead Director determines whether the communications should be forwarded to other members of the Board and forwards them accordingly.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For communications addressed to a particular member of the Board, the Chair of a particular Board committee or the non-employee directors as a group, the Company Secretary forwards those communications directly to those individuals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Alternatively, correspondence may be sent to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Lead Director Eaton Corporation plc Eaton House 30 Pembroke Road Dublin 4, Ireland D04 Y0C2
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Secretary maintains a log of all correspondence addressed to the Board and, except as noted below, forwards all communications to the interested directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, correspondence on a financial topic would be sent to the Chair of the Finance or Audit Committees, and correspondence on governance topics to the Lead Director or Chair of the Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Secretary makes periodic reports to the Governance Committee regarding correspondence from shareholders and other interested parties.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Derivative shareholder communications and demands for inspection of company records should be sent to the Secretary who will promptly disseminate such communications to the entire Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board will consult with the General Counsel or his designee to determine appropriate action.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The directors have requested that communications that do not directly relate to their duties and responsibilities as our directors be excluded from distribution and deleted from email that they access directly.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such excluded items include spam, advertisements, mass mailings, form letters and email campaigns that involve unduly large numbers of similar communications, solicitations for goods, services, employment or contributions, surveys and individual product inquiries or complaints.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, communications that appear to be unduly hostile, intimidating, threatening, illegal or similarly inappropriate will be screened for omission.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any omitted or deleted communications will be made available to any director upon request.

sentences.text: Proposal 2: Approving Amendments to the Articles of Association to Implement Proxy Access
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with a review of the Companys corporate governance practices, the Board decided to proactively propose the adoption of proxy access.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, the Board is recommending that shareholders approve amendments to the Companys Articles of Association to implement proxy access.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxy access will allow eligible shareholders to include their own nominees for election to the Board in the Companys proxy materials, along with the nominees nominated by the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board is committed to strong corporate governance practices and believes that proxy access is in the best interests of the Company and its shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that the implementation of proxy access in the manner set forth in this Proposal 2 will provide meaningful rights to shareholders while ensuring the rights are used by shareholders in a responsible manner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board recommends the implementation of proxy access and, as required under Irish law, now seeks shareholder approval for its adoption.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As required under Irish law, the resolution in this respect of Proposal 2 is a special resolution that requires the affirmative vote of the holders of at least 75% of the votes cast.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because the amendments to the Articles of Association contemplated by this Proposal 2 reference provisions in the amendments to the Articles of Association contemplated by Proposal 3 relating to the amendment of the advance notice provisions of the Articles of Association, the approval of this Proposal 2 is contingent upon the approval of Proposal 3.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: THE TEXT OF THE RESOLUTION IN RESPECT OF PROPOSAL 2 IS AS FOLLOWS:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a special resolution that the Articles of Association be and are hereby amended in the manner provided in Appendix A of the Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors recommends a vote FOR the approval of the amendments to the Companys Articles of Association to implement proxy access.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Description of the Proxy Access Amendments
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The description of the following proposed amendments is only a summary and is qualified in its entirety by reference to the complete text of the proposed amendments, which is attached to this Proxy Statement as Appendix A. We urge you to read Appendix A in its entirety before casting your vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder Eligibility to Nominate Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company will include in its proxy materials shareholder director nominees to the Board if the shareholder and the director nominee satisfy the proxy access requirements under the Articles of Association, including the timely delivery of a shareholder notice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any shareholder or group of not more than twenty shareholders that has maintained ownership of at least 3% of the Companys shares continuously for at least three years as of the date of the shareholder notice will be permitted to include a specified number of director nominees in the Companys proxy materials for the annual general meeting, subject to the conditions below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Number of Shareholder Nominees
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The maximum number of shareholder nominees nominated by all eligible shareholders that the Company will be required to nclude in its proxy materials shall not exceed the greater of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) two and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) 20% of the number of Directors in office as of the ast day on which a notice of proxy access nomination may be delivered to the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any nominee who is included by the Board in the Companys proxy materials as an unopposed (by the Company) nominee pursuant to an agreement with a shareholder or group of shareholders and any nominees who were previously elected to the Board as shareholder nominees at any of the preceding two annual general meetings will be counted against the nominee limit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Calculation of Qualifying Ownership
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to ensure that the interests of shareholders seeking to include director nominees in the Companys proxy materials are aligned with those of other shareholders, a shareholder will be deemed to own only those shares of the Company as to which the shareholder possesses both (1) the full voting and investment rights pertaining to such shares and (2) the full economic interest in (including the opportunity for profit and risk of loss on) such shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following shares will not count as owned shares for purposes of determining whether the ownership threshold has been met:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: shares sold in any transaction that has not been settled or closed;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: shares borrowed or purchased pursuant to an agreement to resell; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: shares subject to any derivative or similar agreement in respect of the Companys shares, which instrument or agreement has the purpose or effect of (1) reducing the full right to vote or direct the voting of any such shares and/or (2) hedging, offsetting or altering the gain or loss arising from the full economic ownership of such shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A shareholder will be deemed to own shares held in the name of a nominee or other intermediary so long as the person retains the full voting and investment rights and the full economic interest in the shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A shareholders ownership of shares will be deemed to continue during any period in which such shareholder delegated any voting power by means of proxy, power of attorney or other instrument or arrangement that is revocable at any time by the shareholder.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A shareholders ownership of shares will also be deemed to continue during any period in which such person has loaned the shares if the person has the power to recall the loaned shares on not more than five business days notice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Information in Proxy Statement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company will include in its proxy statement:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the names of the director nominees;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: information set forth in the Schedule 14N concerning each director nominee and eligible shareholder; and   if the eligible shareholder elects, a written statement of up to 500 words in support of the director nominee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company will be permitted to omit any information or statement that the Company, in good faith, believes is untrue in any material respect or would violate any applicable law, rule, regulation or listing standard.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Information Required From All Nominating Shareholders
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each shareholder seeking to include a director nominee in the Companys proxy materials will be required to provide certain information to the Company, including but not limited to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a copy of the Schedule 14N filed by the shareholder(s) with the SEC;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a written statement and information regarding, the stock ownership of the shareholder; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: in the case of a nomination by a group of shareholders, the designation by all group members of one group member that is authorized to act on behalf of all group members with respect to the nomination and all related matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each shareholder will also be required to make certain representations to, and agreements with, the Company, including but not limited to, that the shareholder:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: will provide a written statement and information regarding the stock ownership of the shareholder;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: acquired the shares in the ordinary course of business and does not have any intent to change or influence control of the Company;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: has not and will not nominate for election any person as a director other than its nominee(s);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: has not and will not engage or participate in a solicitation in support of any person as a director other than its nominee(s) or a nominee of the Board;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: will not distribute any form of proxy for the annual general meeting other than the form distributed by the Company;   will assume liability arising out of the nominating shareholders communications with the Company and its shareholders;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: will assume liability arising out of the nominating shareholders communications with the Company and its shareholders;   will indemnify the Company and its directors, officers and employees for liability arising from or relating to the shareholders communications with Company shareholders or information provided to the Company in connection with the annual general meeting;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: will comply with applicable laws, rules, regulations and listing standards;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: will file with the SEC any solicitation or other communication relating to the annual general meeting, directors or nominee(s);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: will provide such additional information as reasonably requested by the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director nominee will deliver a signed written representation and agreement to the Company setting forth that the directo nominee is not and will not become a party to any agreement, arrangement or understanding:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: as to how the director nominee will act or vote on any issue or question that has not been disclosed to the C
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: that could limit or interfere with the director nominees ability to comply with fiduciary duties; and   with any person or entity other than the Company with respect to any direct or indirect compensation, reimbursement or indemnification in connection with service or action as a director or nominee that has not been disclosed to the Company
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director nominee will deliver a signed written consent to serve as a Director, to have the nominees name in the proxy materials and to the public disclosure of information provided to the Company and a written representation and agreement:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: to comply with the Articles of Association of the Company and all publicly disclosed corporate governance, conflict of interest, confidentiality and stock ownership and trading policies and guidelines of the Company; and   that the nominee intends to serve as a Director for the full term for which the nominee is standing for election.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director nominee will also submit all completed and signed questionnaires required and provide to the Company such other information as reasonably requested by the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If any information or communications provided by any eligible shareholder or nominee is not, when provided, or thereafter ceases to be true, correct and complete in all material respects, the eligible shareholder or nominee shall promptly notify the Company and provide the information that is required to make such information or communication true, correct and not misleading.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nominating Procedures
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to provide adequate time to assess shareholder-nominated nominees, requests to include director nominees in the Companys proxy materials must be received no later than 120 days, and no earlier than 150 days, before the first anniversary of the date that the Companys definitive proxy statement was first released to shareholders in connection with the prior years annual general meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Exclusion of Shareholder Nominees
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company will not be required to include a nominee in the Companys proxy materials if, among other things
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the eligible shareholder or the nominee breaches any of its agreements, representations or warranties in a shareholder notice or otherwise submitted, any information submitted was not, when provided, true, correct and complete or the eligible shareholder or nominee otherwise fails to comply with its obligations under the Articles of Association;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the nominee is not independent under applicable listing standards, rules of the SEC and publicly disclosed standards used by the Board, is or has been an officer or director of a competitor within the past three years, is a named subject of a pending criminal proceeding or has been convicted in a criminal proceeding (excluding traffic violations and other minor offenses) within the past 10 years or is subject to any order of the type specified in Rule 506(d) of Regulation D promulgated under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the Company has received a notice that a shareholder intends to nominate a nominee pursuant to advance notice provision of the Articles of Association;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the election of the nominee would cause the Company to violate its Memorandum or Articles of Association or any applicable law, rule, regulation or listing standard; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the eligible shareholder fails to continuously own the required shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Board or the chairman of the annual general meeting will disregard a nomination if the shareholder does not appear at the annual general meeting in person.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board shall have the power and authority to interpret the Articles of Association and to make all determinations necessary or advisable to apply the proxy access provisions in the Articles of Association.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Procedure if Nominee Limit Is Exceeded
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any shareholder or group of shareholders that submits more than one nominee for inclusion in the Companys proxy materials will be required to rank its nominees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the number of nominees exceeds the nominee limit, the highest ranking eligible nominee from each shareholder or group of shareholders will be included in the Companys proxy materials until the limit is reached, beginning with the shareholder or group of shareholders with the largest number of shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Future Disqualification of Shareholder Nominees and Nominating Shareholders
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any nominee who is included in the Companys proxy materials but withdraws from or becomes ineligible or unavailable for election at the annual general meeting will be ineligible for nomination at the following two annual general meetings.

sentences.text: Proposal 3: Approving Amendments to the Articles of Association regarding Bringing Shareholder Business and Making Director Nominations at an Annual General Meeting
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with a review of the Companys corporate governance practices, the Board decided to propose amendments to the Companys Articles of Association regarding how business is properly requested by a shareholder to be brought before an annual general meeting (amendments to Article 59) and how shareholders may nominate persons for election as Directors at an annual general meeting (amendments to Article 76).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board is committed to strong corporate governance practices and believes that the proposed amendments are in the best interests of the Company and its shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board recommends the implementation of the amendments to Articles 59 and 76 and, as required under Irish law, now seeks shareholder approval for their adoption.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As required under Irish law, the resolution in respect of Proposal 3 is a special resolution that requires the affirmative vote of the holders of at least 75% of the votes cast.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: THE TEXT OF THE RESOLUTION IN RESPECT OF PROPOSAL 3 IS AS FOLLOWS:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a special resolution that the Articles of Association be and are hereby amended in the manner provided in Appendix B of the Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors recommends a vote FOR the approval of the amendments to the Companys Articles of Association regarding bringing shareholder business and making director nominations at an annual general meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Description of Amendments
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The description of the following proposed amendments is only a summary and is qualified in its entirety by reference to the complete text of the proposed amendments, which is attached to this Proxy Statement as Appendix B. We urge you to read Appendix B in its entirety before casting your vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Article 59
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In conjunction with the proxy access amendments described in Proposal 2, the Board is proposing to amend Article 59 to change the deadline for business to be properly requested by a shareholder to be brought before an annual general meeting and clarify what information the shareholder must provide related to the business to be brought before an annual general meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Article 59 amendments specify that the shareholder notice must be received no later than 90 days, and no earlier than 120 days, before the first anniversary of the date that the Companys definitive proxy statement was first released to shareholders in connection with the prior years annual general meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Currently under Article 59, shareholder notices must be received no later than 60 days, and no earlier than 90 days.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This change aligns the deadline for proposing business with the deadline for shareholders to nominate persons for appointment as Directors other than nominations pursuant to the proxy access provisions of the new Article 78A.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Article 59 amendments also clarify certain information that must be provided to the Company including
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: That if notice is provided by the shareholder on behalf of a beneficial owner then information must be provided as to both the shareholder and beneficial owner;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: That if the shareholder or the beneficial owner on whose behalf the business is being proposed is an entity then certain information as to share ownership and agreements between parties must be provided as to the proposing entity as well as to any director, executive, managing member or other control person of the entity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 3: Approving Amendments to the Articles of Association regarding Bringing Shareholder Business and Making Director Nominations at an Annual General Meeting
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Clarifying that the shareholder must update the Company if the information provided in its notice changes prior to the annua general meeting; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Requiring that the shareholder and beneficial owner (if any) agree to public disclosure of the information provided to the Company pursuant to Article 59.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Article 76
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In conjunction with the proxy access amendments described in Proposal 2, the Board is proposing to amend Article 76 to change the deadline that nominations of persons for appointment as Directors may be made by other than complying with the new proxy access requirements in the new Article 78A and clarify what information the shareholder must provide related to such nominations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board is proposing to amend Article 76 to specify that for nominations to be timely, the shareholder notice must be received no later than 90 days, and no earlier than 120 days, before the first anniversary of the date that the Companys definitive proxy statement was first released to shareholders in connection with the prior years annual general meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Currently under Article 76, shareholder notices must be received no later than 60 days, and no earlier than 90 days.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This change is desirable in light of the provisions of the proxy access right in the new Article 78A, which provides that the right is not available if a shareholder makes a nomination pursuant to Article 76.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, these time periods are more in line with common market practice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Changing the deadline for nominations pursuant to Article 76 will allow the Company to have sufficient time to review any submissions pursuant to Article 76 and 78A to determine which shareholder nominated director candidates will be eligible for election at the annual general meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Article 76 amendments also clarify certain information that must be provided to the Company including:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: shareholder and beneficial owner;   That if the shareholder or the beneficial owner on whose behalf the nomination is being made is an entity then certain information as to share ownership and agreements between parties must be provided as to the proposing entity as well as to any director, executive, managing member or other control person of the entity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Requiring representations that the director nominee proposed by the shareholder has disclosed agreements between the nominee and other parties relating to the nominees actions and compensation as a nominee and as a director if elected and that the nominee is not party to an agreement that could limit or interfere with the nominees ability to comply with fiduciary duties;   Requiring a representation that the nominee proposed by the shareholder intends to serve as a director for the full term for
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Requiring a representation that the nominee proposed by the shareholder intends to serve as a director for the full term for which the nominee is standing for election; and   Requiring that the shareholder and beneficial owner (if any) agree to public disclosure of the information provided to the
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Requiring that the shareholder and beneficial owner (if any) agree to public disclosure of the information provided to the Company pursuant to Article 76.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, some clarification amendments to definitions and adjournments to meetings are being proposed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors recommends a vote FOR this proposal to approve the amendments to the Articles of Association regarding bringing shareholder business and making director nominations at an annual general meeting.

sentences.text: Proposal 4: Appointment of Independent Auditor and Authorization of Audit Committee to Set Auditor Remuneration
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders are being asked to appoint our independent auditor and to authorize the Audit Committee of our Board of Directors to set the auditors remuneration.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Appointment of the independent auditor and authorization of the Audit Committee to set its remuneration require the affirmative vote of a majority of the votes cast by the holders of ordinary shares represented at the annual general meeting in person or by proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee and the Board recommend that shareholders reappoint Ernst & Young LLP as our independent auditor to audit our accounts for the fiscal year ending December 31, 2017 and authorize the Audit Committee of the Board to set the auditors remuneration.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A representative of Ernst & Young LLP will be present at the annual general meeting to answer any questions concerning the independent auditors areas of responsibility and will have an opportunity to make a statement if he or she desires to do so.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: AUDIT COMMITTEE REPORT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee of the Board of Directors is responsible for assisting the Board in overseeing: (1) the integrity of the Companys consolidated financial statements and its systems of internal accounting and financial controls, (2) the independence, qualifications and performance of the Companys independent auditor, (3) the performance of the Companys internal auditors, and (4) the Companys compliance with legal and regulatory requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committees specific responsibilities, as described in its charter, include the sole authority to appoint, terminate and compensate the Companys independent auditor, and to pre-approve all audit services and other permitted non-audit services to be provided to the Company by the independent auditor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee is currently comprised of five directors, all of whom are independent under the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, the rules of the Securities and Exchange Commission and the Board of Directors own independence criteria.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors amended the Committees charter most recently on October 25, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A copy of the charter is available on the Companys website at http://www.eaton.com/governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has retained Ernst & Young LLP as Eatons independent auditor for 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ernst & Young has been the independent auditor for the Company or its predecessor since 1923.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The members of the Audit Committee and the Board believe that due to Ernst & Youngs deep knowledge of the Company and of the industries in which the Company operates, it is in the best interests of the Company and its shareholders to continue retention of Ernst & Young to serve as Eatons independent auditor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In carrying out its responsibilities, the Audit Committee has reviewed, and has discussed with the Companys management and independent auditor, the Companys 2016 audited consolidated financial statements and the assessment of the Companys internal control over financial reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has also discussed with Ernst & Young the matters required to be discussed by applicable auditing standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has received the written disclosures from Ernst & Young regarding their independence from the Company that are required by applicable requirements of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board regarding the independent auditors communications with the Audit Committee concerning independence, has discussed with Ernst & Young their independence and has considered whether their provision of non-audit services to the Company is compatible with their independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based upon the foregoing review and discussions, the Committee recommended to the Board that the financial statements be included in the Companys Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2016 and annual report to shareholders
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 5: Advisory Approval of the Companys Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are asking our shareholders to approve, on an advisory basis, the compensation of our named executive officers as disclosed in this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although this is an advisory vote, and therefore not binding on our Board of Directors, the Board and the Compensation and Organization Committee will review and consider the voting results when making future decisions regarding our executive compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This say-on-pay vote is required under U.S. law, and we consider it to be a matter of good corporate governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This vote takes place annually and the next advisory vote to approve the Companys executive compensation will occur at the 2018 annual general meeting of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As we explain in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis that follows, our executive compensation programs are designe to attract, motivate, reward and retain our named executive officers, who are critical to the success of our Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our programs reward our named executive officers for achieving specific annual, long-term and strategic goals, and also for increasing shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NAMED EXECUTIVE OFFICERS COMPENSATION PROGRAM HIGHLIGHTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of our pay for performance culture, our executive compensation plans include the following:   Other features of these programs include:   On average, 80% of our named executive officers compensation is performance based.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our plans deliver awards below target, or none at all, when Company performance does not meet threshold levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive incentive programs are intended to deliver target awards when our performance aligns with our peer group median performance, and awards exceeding 150% of target when our performance is at or above the top quartile of our peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our share ownership requirements range from one times base salary for our general managers to six times base salary for the Companys Chairman and CEO of Eaton Corporation;   Our incentive plan payouts are capped to prevent unintended windfalls;   Our compensation clawback policy allows us to recover incentive compensation in case of employee misconduct that causes the need for a material restatement of financial results; and   We do not enter into employment contracts with any of our salaried U.S. employees, including the named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation and Organization Committee continually reviews the compensation programs for named executive officers to ensure that they achieve the desired goals of aligning our executive compensation structure with our shareholders interests and current market practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All Committee members are independent directors committed to applying sound governance practices to compensation decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We strongly encourage you to review the Compensation Discussion and Analysis that follows.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It contains information about the extensive processes the Committee follows, and the factors it considers, when establishing performance and pay targets and approving actual payments from our short- and long-term performance-based incentive plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committees process ncludes reviewing a variety of reports and analyses such as market survey data, compensation tally sheets, compensation at peer companies, and reports from proxy advisory firms.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Discussion and Analysis also describes the structure of our compensation programs and the 2016 compensation of our named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that our executive compensation design and strategy is a critical factor in motivating our executives to seek innovative solutions that contribute to Eatons continued success.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are therefore asking shareholders to approve the following advisory resolution at the 2017 annual general meeting:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED, that the Companys shareholders approve, on an advisory basis, the compensation of the named executive officers, as disclosed in the Companys proxy statement for the 2017 annual general meeting of shareholders pursuant to the compensation disclosure rules of the Securities and Exchange Commission, including the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, the 2016 Summary Compensation Table and the other related tables and disclosure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors recommends a vote FOR advisory approval of executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Discussion and Analysis
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In this Compensation Discussion and Analysis (CD&A), we discuss our pay for performance philosophy, our pay-setting process, the components of our executive compensation program, and the compensation of our named executive officers for 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also explain our performance metrics in detail and review our executive compensation policies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please note that the use of we, us or our throughout this CD&A refers to the Company, its subsidiaries or its management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the use of Chairman and Chief Executive Officer or CEO throughout this CD&A refers to Craig Arnold, Chairman of the Company and Chief Executive Officer of Eaton Corporation as of June 1, 2016 and Alexander M. Cutler prior to June 1, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This section provides a summary of the performance metrics and actual results for the incentive plans in which our named executive officers and other executives participated for the year ending December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, our named executive officers are:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Craig Arnold, Chairman of the Company and Chief Executive Officer of Eaton Corporation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Alexander M. Cutler, Retired Chairman of the Company and Chief Executive Officer of Eaton Corporatio
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Richard H. Fearon, Vice Chairman and Chief Financial and Planning Officer of Eaton Corporation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Revathi Advaithi, Chief Operating OfficerElectrical Sector of Eaton Corporatio
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Uday Yadav, Chief Operating OfficerIndustrial Sector of Eaton Corporation

sentences.text: Mark M. McGuire, Executive Vice President, General Counsel and Secretary of Eaton Corporatio

sentences.text: Executive Compensation Philosophy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We design our executive compensation plans and programs to help attract, motivate, reward, and retain highly qualified executives who are capable of creating and sustaining value for our shareholders over the long term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We endorse compensation actions that fairly reflect Company performance as well as the responsibilities and personal performance of individual executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HIGHLIGHTS OF OUR EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION PROGRAM
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation programs are intended to align the interests of our executives with those of our stakeholders and are structured to reflect best practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On average, 80% of our named executive officers compensation is performance-based and tied to our short- and long-term incentive programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Key features of these programs include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Caps on potential payouts under our short- and long-term incentive plans;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder-approved short-term and long-term incentive plans;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A clawback policy;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A policy that prohibits hedging or pledging of our shares;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Share ownership and holding requirements;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No tax gross-ups;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No employment contracts; and,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Double-trigger equity vesting upon a change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pay for Performance Culture
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation programs reflect the belief that the amount earned by our executives must, to a significant extent, depend on achieving rigorous Company, business unit and individual performance objectives designed to enhance shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In prior years, we illustrated the correlation between cumulative shareholder returns and Mr. Cutlers compensation over his tenure as CEO.
