sentences.text: SHORT-TERM INCENTIVES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Goals under our short-term, performance-based incentive plan were achieved at 92% of target but the Committee elected to reduce the payout to 85%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committees decision to reduce the award, along with other efforts such as restructuring actions, reducing discretionary spending, and tightening inventory controls helped fulfill our commitments to our investors despite the impact that sluggish market conditions had on Eatons earnings and revenue in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A bonus pool equal to 1.5% of Annual Net Income served as the initial funding mechanism for our Senior Executive Incentive Compensation Plan (Senior EIC Plan).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Committee established Operating Earnings Per Share (EPS) (which exclude acquisition integration charges) and Cash Flow Return on Gross Capital (CFR) goals that also are used in determining actual awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the target EPS and CFR objectives were $4.30 and 16.8%, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Actual EPS and CFR were $4.22 and 16.1%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 EXECUTIVE INCENTIVE COMPENSATION PLAN GOALS AND RESULTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: LONG-TERM INCENTIVES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our long-term, performance-based Executive Strategic Incentive Plan (ESIP) achieved a 25% payout for the 2013-2016 award period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The target cumulative EPS and CFR goals for the 2013-2016 award period were $21.34 and 20.4%, respectively Our actual cumulative EPS over the four-year award period of $17.32 was below the threshold level necessary to earn a payment for the EPS growth metric but actual average CFR of 16.8% exceeded the CFR threshold of 8%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2013-2016 ESIP opportunities took the form of phantom share units based on our share price at the beginning of the award period in 2013 and were settled in cash based on the share price at the end of the award period in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, appreciation in Eatons share price over the four-year award period impacted the value that our executives realized from the ESIP awards, which is consistent with our policy of aligning their interests with those of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Review of 2016 Advisory Vote on Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors is committed to understanding the views of our shareholders by providing an opportunity to endorse our executive compensation through an advisory, non-binding vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, our shareholders approved our executives compensation by a vote of 94%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee considered these voting results, shareholder feedback, as well as a comprehensive assessment of Eatons executive compensation programs and decided to change the performance criteria for our long-term ESIP beginning in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This change is summarized below and the change to the vesting of shares into retirement is discussed on page 34.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee will continue to review our compensation programs each year in light of the annual say-on-pay voting results and shareholder feedback.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Change to Performance-Based Long-Term Incentive Performance Criteria
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective with the 2016-2018 ESIP period, awards will be determined based on our total return to shareholders (TSR) ranked against a group of companies (TSR Peer Group).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with our historical practice, awards under this plan design are capped at 200% of target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to 2016, awards were determined based on company performance versus operating EPS growth and CFR goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In setting the EPS growth and CFR goals for the prior periods, the Board would evaluate our Strategic Plan projections and analysts estimates of peer company performance; however, the impact of changes in market growth rates has had a disproportionate impact on actual versus forecasted results and it has become increasingly difficult to forecast absolute performance against our peers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, the Committee changed the performance criteria to relative TSR which alleviates the increasingly difficult market calibration issue and introduces a stronger sense of relative peer performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This change also eliminates any concern about the use of overlapping EPS and CFR criteria in our short-term incentive plans (Senior EIC and EIC) and our performance-based long term incentive plan (ESIP).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The short-term incentive plans will continue to focus on annual EPS and CFR goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We and the Committee believe a short-term plan with an earnings growth and return on assets orientation (via the EPS and CFR goals) complemented by a TSR-driven long-term plan is an effective combination that will enhance shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior Year Changes That Impact the Summary Compensation Table
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective with the 2015-2017 award period, the Committee approved a change in the form of the ESIP opportunities from phantom shares that are settled in cash to performance share units that settle in our ordinary shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee made this change because the accounting treatment for share-based long-term performance awards is more favorable than it is for the cash-settled plans, which are subject to mark-to-market accounting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although this change did not result in larger ESIP target or payout opportunities to participants, the change distorts Total Compensation reported in the Summary Compensation Table.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The distortion occurs because we are reporting grants that were made in the most recently reported year as Stock Awards and the cash payout for the ESIP performance period that concluded in the reported year as Non-Equity Incentive Plan Compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This distortion occurred in 2015 and 2016 and will occur in 2017, after which time the cash-based ESIP periods will have matured and there will be no more dual reporting of grants and payouts in the Summary Compensation Table.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Discussion and Analysis  Executive Compensation Philosophy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The realized pay table differs from the Summary Compensation Table in a number of ways, including:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to pay actually received, the Summary Compensation Table includes the accounting value of equity compensation granted during the year, which may or may not ever be earned.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In contrast, this realized pay table reports only the elements of compensation actually received and/or realized by Mr. Arnold and Mr. Cutler in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Specifically, the values for equity awards in the realized pay table show the gross compensation (before applicable taxes) that Mr. Arnold and Mr. Cutler received in 2016 upon the exercise of stock options and the vesting of RSUs (as shown in the Option Exercises and Stock Vested in 2016 table on page 57), regardless of when these options or awards were granted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the realized pay table does not reflect compensation that is based upon pension value increases and above- market nonqualified deferred compensation earnings, although these amounts are included in the Summary Compensation Table.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee reviews compensation that is based upon the change in pension values and above-market nonqualified deferred compensation earnings as part of the Tally Sheet review discussed on page 36 in the context of a competitive overall benefit design and not as an element of its annual compensation decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION PHILOSOPHY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We design our executive compensation plans and programs to help attract, motivate, reward, and retain highly qualified executives who are capable of creating and sustaining value for our shareholders over the long term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We endorse compensation actions that fairly reflect Company performance as well as the responsibilities and personal performance of individual executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ROLE OF THE COMPENSATION AND ORGANIZATION COMMITTEE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Membership and Responsibilities
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation and Organization Committee of the Board of Directors in 2016 consisted of six independent non-employee directors and is supported by our human resources department.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As discussed below, the Committee also may retain one or more independent compensation consultants to assist it.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee is responsible for handling a variety of organizational and compensation matters pertaining to Eatons leadership, including those shown in the table below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation-related Tasks
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reviews succession planning for officer positions including the position of the CEO;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reviews proposed organization or responsibility changes at the senior officer level; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Determines the compensation for our senior officers, including salary and short- and long-term incentive opportunities;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reviews our practices for the recruitment and development of a diverse talent pool.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reviews compensation practices relating to key employees to confirm that these practices remain equitable and competitive; and   Reviews new employee benefit plans or significant changes in such
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committees charter is available on our website at http://www.eaton.com/governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Use of Consultants
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee retained Meridian Compensation Partners as its independent executive compensation consultant to support the Committees oversight and management of our executive compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The consultants duties include helping the Committee validate our executive compensation plans and programs through periodic comprehensive studies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The consultant performed a variety of work for the Committee, including assessing Eatons executive compensation programs relative to market trends and best-in-class governance practices, providing independent feedback on our analytical work, and assisting the Committee in its review and discussion of material agenda items and its decision-making about our executive
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: compensation programs and individual compensation opportunities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The consultant also coordinated and supported the annual performance appraisal for Mr. Arnold.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee used this appraisal as one of several factors in determining his payout under our short-term incentive plan for 2016 and also considered it in determining whether to adjust his base salary or his short- and long-term incentive targets for the next year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committees written policies require the Company to obtain its review and approval before awarding any material consulting assignment to a firm that the Committee already has engaged.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This policy ensures that the Committees consultants are well positioned to provide independent and impartial advice on executive compensation and governance matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ADJUSTMENTS TO COMPENSATION PROGRAMS FOR 2016
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee made the following changes in 2016 to ensure plans and programs align with common practices in the external market.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Change in Long-Term Performance Plan Performance Criteria
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to 2016, awards were determined based on company performance versus operating EPS growth and CFR goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In setting the EPS growth and CFR goals for the prior periods, the Board would evaluate our Strategic Plan projections and analysts estimates of peer company performance; however, the impact of changes in market growth rates has had a disproportionate impact on actual versus forecasted results and it has become increasingly difficult to forecast absolute performance against our peers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective with the 2016-2018 ESIP period, awards will be determined based on our total return to shareholders (TSR) ranked against that of the TSR Peer Group described on pages 36 and 42.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with our historical practice, awards under this plan design are capped at 200% of target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, if our TSR is positive but ranks the lowest among the TSR Peer Group, the maximum payout that can be earned is 25% of target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If our TSR is the highest when compared to that of the peer companies, but is negative, then the maximum payout that can be earned is 100% of target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The companies in the TSR Peer Group are listed on page 36.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fourteen of the companies in the TSR Peer Group are direct peers in either the Electrical, Hydraulics, Aerospace or Vehicle segments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The number of directly competitive peers in each segment roughly equates to the percentage of that segments revenue as a percent of total Eaton revenues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have also identified six indirect but relevant peers, which when combined with the Electrical peers represent the Electrical sector weightings within all of Eaton.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Rationale: The change in performance criteria will alleviate the market calibration issue and introduce a stronger sense of relative peer performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We and the Committee believe a short-term plan with an earnings growth and return on assets orientation (via the EPS and CFR goals) complemented by a TSR-driven long-term plan is an effective combination that will enhance shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This new peer group will not be the primary compensation peer group that we use to set individual pay targets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Instead, we will continue to use the data reported in third-party surveys (as described on page 35) as our primary resource in setting pay for our executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vesting of Shares into Retirement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective March 1, 2016, equity grants may continue to vest according to the terms of the grant agreement for employees who are age 55 or older with 10 or more years of service who either (1) retire in good-standing or (2) who are terminated through no fault of their own due to a company action.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (All scenarios are referred to as retirement for purposes of this topic.)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, retirees will be able to exercise outstanding stock options for the remaining term of the grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee will retain its discretion to cancel shares in the event that (1) an executive does not provide proper notice of retirement or (2) retires and begins working for a competitor or (3) for any other reason the Committee determines is in Eatons best interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Previously, all shares or options that would have otherwise vested within 12 months of retirement would have vested at etirement and all other outstanding equity grants were forfeited.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, executives could exercise outstanding stock options for the lesser of five years or the remaining term of the stock option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The continued vesting applies to time-based awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are not making changes to vesting practices for performance-based ESIP awards which are subject to proration for time worked in the performance period and to the company achieving the performance metrics for each respective award period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any prorated ESIP awards earned by retired executives will be paid after the award period has ended and actual performance has been measured.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All long-term incentive plan participants will be eligible for this treatment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of January 31, 2016, there were approximately 680 employees who were eligible for long-term incentive awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Rationale: The Committee reviewed surveys of external market practices which report that the majority of companies allow shares to vest beyond retirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This change was made to align our practice with the most common practice in the market.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HOW WE ESTABLISH AND VALIDATE PAY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This section explains the Committees process for establishing and validating our pay targets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As shown in the table and described in detail below, this process involves several important analyses:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Analysis  Data Source  Purpose  How Its Used  When Its Conducted Market Analysis   Aon Hewitt Associates and Towers Watson Executive Compensation databases   Setting pay for our executives   Setting base pay and short- and long-term incentive targets for the next year/award cycle   October  February Performance Assessments   Executive feedback   Evaluating individual performance based on input from the CEO   Determining the short-term incentive award payments for the award period that recently ended and in determining merit increases and adjusting individual award opportunities for the next award cycle   November  January Tally Sheets   Internal compensation and benefits data   Evaluating total remuneration and internal pay equity of our executives   Evaluating the total remuneration and projected payments to the named executive officers under various termination scenarios.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This study also provides insight into how competitors establish their pay for performance profile.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Total Compensation Analysis and Planning Process (OctoberFebruary)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We target total compensation to be within the median range of compensation paid by similarly sized industrial companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We continuously monitor and assess the competitive retention and recruiting pressures in the industries and markets where we compete for executive talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, the Committee periodically has exercised its judgment to set target compensation levels of certain executives above the market median to foster retention.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Several different analyses play a role in the Committees Total Compensation Analysis and Annual Planning Process
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Market Analysis  From October through December of each year, our human resources department conducts a market analysis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: First, we align our executives positions with comparable positions as reported in surveys published by two national consulting firms, Aon Hewitt and Towers Watson.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Then, in February, we prepare a comprehensive report for the Committee, which also is reviewed by its independent consultant, that compares our executives compensation to the average of the surveys median compensation data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This helps the Committee determine how each executive officers compensation compares to current market practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In preparing our comparison for 2016, we used the survey results for industrial companies (as categorized by the survey vendors), whether publicly or privately held, with revenues between $10 billion and $50 billion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The group contains between 100 and 120 companies in which the revenue range is approximately one-half to two times our revenue.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We feel this comparator group adequately represents the market in which we compete for talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The companies participating in each survey vary, and we are not able to determine which of the companies reported data for each position and each component of pay.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Analysis of Internal Pay Equity and our Current Pay Levels  Internal equity among similarly situated positions is an important consideration in establishing individual pay targets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We maintain internal equity by establishing approximately the same target incentive opportunities for similarly situated positions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When determining what positions are similarly situated, we consider the following aspects of each position: its essential functions, the ability of the position holder to influence our overall results, any educational requirements, where the position stands in our leadership ranks, and job demands such as frequent travel and the responsibility to respond to business matters at any time and under any circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tally Sheets  In addition to the market analysis, each February we provide the Committee with a comprehensive compensation Tally Sheet for each named executive officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These Tally Sheets, which also are reviewed by the Committees independent consultant, help the Committee evaluate total remuneration and internal pay equity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee reviews them before making decisions about the compensation of the named executive officers for the next year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each Tally Sheet includes all components of the executives current compensation, including base salary, short-term incentive compensation, long-term cash incentive compensation, equity incentive compensation, retirement savings programs, health and welfare programs, and the cost of personal executive benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee also reviews potential payments under various termination scenarios.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Assessments  Assessments of executive performance are another key part of the Committees Total Compensation Analysis and Planning Process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Arnold meets individually with his direct reports, including the named executive officers, to discuss the performance assessments for their respective direct reports and to formulate initial recommendations for an appropriate total compensation plan for each executive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No member of management, including Mr. Arnold, makes recommendations regarding his or her own pay.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee meets with its independent consultant in Executive Session (with no members of management in attendance) to review Mr. Arnolds performance assessment, the comprehensive market data for his position and his Tally Sheet to establish his total compensation plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Evaluating Pay
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In July of each year, the Committee evaluates pay relative to external market data to validate the individual compensation opportunities that were established in February, and also considers whether we are setting appropriate performance hurdles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This process involves collecting and reviewing peer group information and third party survey data and analyzing it as described below.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Peer Group Selection  We do not use a comparator group of companies to set individual compensation targets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, in 2016, the Board of Directors selected a strategic peer group of twenty-two companies whose performance is considered in the context of setting our Strategic and Annual Profit Plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective with the three-year award period that began on January 1, 2016, the twenty publicly traded companies in this group serve as the TSR Peer Group for purposes of determining relative TSR performance and payouts under ESIP, which is described on page 42.

sentences.text: Peer Pay Analysis  Although the strategic peer group does not serve as a compensation peer group, we do provide the Committee with an analysis that includes the compensation reported by each publicly traded peer in its annual proxy statement and market survey data for positions that are equivalent to positions held by our named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee uses this analysis in reviewing and establishing our stretch incentive plan goals and in answering whether our compensation targets are appropriate relative to market comparators.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, this review of survey and peer proxy data confirmed that Eatons compensation opportunities were aligned with the external data points.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee also affirmed that it would continue to use the data reported in the two previously mentioned compensation surveys as the basis for setting individual compensation opportunities, but would use the peer proxy data as a secondary data point if an executives compensation was well below or above the survey comparator group median.

sentences.text: In prior years, we also conducted a peer pay targeting and performance hurdle study that analyzed our peers pay for performance profiles relative to that of their own peer groups.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This helped the Committee to determine if we were setting rigorous and appropriate performance hurdles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This analysis was irrelevant in 2016 because
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) we adopted relative TSR as our long-term incentive performance criteria and are no longer setting performance hurdles and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) the strategic peer group does not serve as a compensation peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The peers were chosen based on their industry segment, among other considerations, so that the overall revenue of each segment would approximate Eatons revenues for each segment (Aerospace, Electrical, Hydraulics, Vehicle) versus overall revenue for the entire enterprise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The revenue of many companies in the strategic peer group is smaller than Eatons and given that there is a correlation between the revenue size of a company and the pay it delivers, the Committee determined that the strategic peer group would not serve as an appropriate peer group for purposes of setting pay.

sentences.text: PERFORMANCE BASED LONG-TERM INCENTIVES FOR THE PERIOD ENDING DECEMBER 31, 2016 2013-2016 ESIP  In February 2013, the Committee established challenging EPS compound growth rate and CFR performance goals for the 2013-2016 ESIP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CFR objective focused management on driving attractive returns on the capital we employ over the multi-year award period, while the EPS goal focused management on driving earnings growth throughout the multi-year cycle.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee used a comprehensive report that analyzed publicly available peer group financial data to establish the CFR and EPS objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board also used this report in reviewing our Strategic and Profit Plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The report includes:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A comparison of our past performance across a range of performance metrics, compared to those same metrics as reported for our peer group;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our estimated financial results and those for each peer group company as projected by sell-side analysts who follow these companies; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A review of our strategic objectives and annual business plans for the multi-year performance period
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The EPS growth and CFR goals for the award period were weighted equally.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee set performance hurdles at levels such that our executives would receive payment of approximately 100% of the target incentive opportunity if our performance over the award period was at or above the projected median of performance compared to that of our peer group that was in place at the time the opportunity was established, and payment at or above 150% of the target incentive opportunity if our performance over the award period was at or above the projected top 25th percentile of performance of our peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We capped CFR and EPS growth goals under ESIP at 200% of target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This cap is consistent with the maximum incentive opportunity as reported by the companies that respond to the compensation surveys to which we subscribe.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The key to achieving an above-target payout for this ESIP period was to fully meet our annual operating plans, exceed our targeted operating margins and our earnings per share targets, closely manage our working capital and fully achieve our committed integration and synergy targets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to setting ESIP goals, in February 2013, the Committee also set individual ESIP target award opportunities for each named executive officer that represented approximately 50% of his or her total long-term incentive opportunity that was established in 2013.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Individual target opportunities were expressed as a cash value and then converted to phantom share units based on the average New York Stock Exchange price of Eaton ordinary shares over the first 20 trading days of the award period, which was $56.27.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Phantom share units align the interests of the executives with those of the shareholders because the units reflect appreciation or depreciation and earnings on our ordinary shares during the performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payout of 2013-2016 ESIP  The CFR component of the 2013-2016 ESIP was achieved at 16.8%, which was above the threshold level of 8.0% needed to generate a payout under the plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Actual EPS growth of $17.32 was below the minimum level of $18.95 that was necessary to generate a payout for the EPS component of the award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The combined results generated a payout of 25% of target.

sentences.text: How Our CFR and EPS Goals Used in Short- and Long-Term Incentive Plans Prior to 2016 Differ
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We and the Committee believe that Earnings Per Share and Cash Flow Return on Gross Capital are appropriate metrics to use in our short-term and long-term incentive plans because of the impact these items have on creating shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although we used an earnings per share (EPS) metric in both our short- and long-term incentive plans prior to 2016, the two metrics were different:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The short-term plan metric is tied to annual EPS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A goal is set in February of each year based on items such as EPS guidance for the year, market analyses and our annual profit plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The long-term ESIP metric was tied to EPS growth and the corresponding CFR over a four- or three-year period, as applicable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This multi-year goal was set based on the Boards review of our Strategic Plan and the long-term, five-year financial goals that we shared with investors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, relative TSR became the performance criteria for ESIP, thereby eliminating the concern that we use the same metrics in our short- and long-term incentive plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Establishment of Performance Criteria for the 2016-2018 ESIP  The Committee adopted relative TSR as the performance criteria for the 2016-2018 ESIP period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to 2016, awards were determined based on company performance versus operating EPS growth and CFR goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In setting the EPS growth and CFR goals for the prior periods, the Board would evaluate our Strategic Plan projections and analysts estimates of peer company performance; however, the impact of changes in market growth rates has had a disproportionate impact on actual versus forecasted results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, the Committee chose TSR as the metric to alleviate the increasingly difficult market calibration issues and to introduce a stronger sense of relative
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: peer performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The change also eliminates any concern about the use of overlapping criteria in our Senior EIC and EIC and our ESIP program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: with an earnings growth and return on assets orientation (via the EPS and CFR goals) complemented by a TSR-driven long- term plan is an effective combination that will enhance shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards for the 2016-2018 award period will be determined based on our total return to shareholders (TSR) relative to that of the TSR Peer Group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSR is calculated by taking the total of share price appreciation and dividends (assuming immediate reinvestment of dividends) over the three year period compared to our share price at the beginning of the period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our TSR rank among the TSR Peer Group will determine an adjustment factor which can range from 0% to 200%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with our historical practice, awards under this plan design are capped at 200% of target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, if our TSR is positive but ranks the lowest among the peer group, the maximum payout that can be earned is 25% of target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If our TSR is the highest when compared to that of the peer companies, but is negative, then the maximum payout that can be earned is 100% of target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The TSR Peer Group for the 2016-2018 award period includes nineteen companies, thirteen of whom are direct peers in either the Electrical, Hydraulics, Aerospace or Vehicle segments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The number of directly competitive peers in each segment roughly equates to the percentage of that segments revenue as a percent of total Eaton revenues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The remaining six peers are indirect but relevant peers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The companies included in the TSR Peer Group are:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Direct Peers: ABB, Ltd., Allison Transmission Holdings, Inc., BorgWarner, Inc., Cummins Inc., Emerson Electric Co., Hubbell Inc.,Legrand S.A., Moog Inc., Parker-Hannifin Corporation, Rockwell Automation Inc., Schneider Electric SE, Siemens AG, and Woodward, Inc. (Federal-Mogul Corporation was also originally included in the Direct Peer Group but has been removed because the company is no longer publicly traded.)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Indirect Peers: Deere & Company, Dover Corporation, Honeywell International Inc., Illinois Tool Works Inc., Ingersoll-Rand plc, and United Technologies Corporation.

sentences.text: Health and Welfare Benefits and Retirement Income Plans
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide our executive officers with the same health and welfare and retirement income benefit programs that we provide to our other salaried employees in the United States, with certain exceptions described below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our named executive officers may choose to participate in our 401(k) plan and receive Company matching contributions, which are reported as Other Compensation in the Summary Compensation Table.

sentences.text: We provide 401(k) matching contributions that comply with Internal Revenue Code limits.

sentences.text: In place of typical Company-paid group term life insurance, we provide all executive officers and approximately 600 other employees who were hired prior to January 1, 2016 with Company-paid life insurance coverage under two separate policies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The aggregate value of the two policies is approximately equal to an executives annual base salary, and this level of coverage is consistent with the level of coverage provided to other non-union U.S. salaried employees through our group term life policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The majority of the executives life insurance (base salary minus $50,000) is covered under an executive-owned individual whole-life policy, with the remaining $50,000 of insurance covered under our group term life policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees who were hired on or after January 1, 2016 are provided coverage approximately equal to one time base salary under our group term life policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The value of the Company-paid premium for the whole life policy is imputed as income to each covered executive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We decided to provide this executive life insurance arrangement to allow each executive to have a paid-up policy at retirement that would mirror Company-provided post-retirement group term life insurance, but with less post-retirement tax complexity for both the executive and the Company.

sentences.text: These benefits that accrued after January 1, 2005 will be paid in the form of a single sum at retirement.

sentences.text: In response to market practices and to enhance our ability to attract and retain key executives, the Board of Directors also adopted plans that provide supplemental annual retirement income to certain executives whom we hire mid-career, because they do not have the opportunity to accumulate significant credited service with us under our tax-qualified retirement income or nonqualified restoration plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These supplemental plans deliver a benefit if the executive either retires at 55 or older with at least 10 years of service, or at 65 or older regardless of the years of service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No new participants have been added to this plan since 2011.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The tax-qualified pension plans that we maintain for our U.S. salaried and non-union employees define the term compensation to include base salary, overtime pay, pay premiums and awards under any short-term variable pay or incentive compensation plans (including amounts deferred for receipt at a later date).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We use this same definition for calculating pension benefits under the nonqualified executive retirement income arrangements described above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These qualified and nonqualified retirement income plans are the only compensation or benefit plans or programs that we provide to executive officers that consider base salary and earned annual incentive awards in the calculation of the executives account balances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-term incentives, including cash and amounts realized upon the exercise of stock options and/or vesting or RSUs or RSAs, are not factored into these calculations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferral Plans
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide our executives with opportunities to defer the receipt of their earned and otherwise payable awards under our short- and long-term cash incentive plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our deferral plans do not allow executive to defer the receipt of their share-based awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We offer these deferral arrangements so that our executives have a competitive opportunity to accumulate additional retirement assets and a means to meet our share ownership guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Personal Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide our executive officers with limited personal benefits such as reimbursement for financial and estate planning and tax preparation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Personal benefits are treated as taxable income to the executive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employment Contracts and Change of Control Agreements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not provide our executive officers with employment contracts; however, we do enter into Change of Control Agreements with each executive officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The agreements do not contain tax gross-up provisions, but do contain double-trigger severance provisions and restrictive covenants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These agreements provide benefits if an executives employment is terminated or materially changed for certain reasons following a change of control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that these agreements are in the best interest of our shareholders because they help ensure that we will have the continued dedication and focus of key executives in the event of a change of control of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Details of our Change of Control Agreements may be found in the narrative discussion accompanying the Potential Payments Upon Termination beginning on page 61.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Limited Tax Protection for Relocation and Foreign Assignments
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We and the Committee believe that tax protection is appropriate in very limited circumstances to avoid the potential for the value of a benefit to be reduced as a result of tax requirements that are beyond an executives control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Specifically, we provide tax protection for our employees under our relocation and foreign assignment policies so that they are able to make decisions to accept new assignments without concern that relocating would be a disadvantage from a tax standpoint.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Use of Our Aircraft
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We own, operate, and maintain Company aircraft to enhance the ability of our executive officers and other corporate and business leaders to conduct business in an effective manner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This principle guides how the aircraft are used.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our stringent aircraft use policy ensures that the primary use of this mode of transportation is to satisfy business needs and that all aircraft use is accounted for at all times and in accordance with applicable laws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has directed Mr. Arnold to use our aircraft for his business and personal travel, whenever feasible, to ensure his personal security and enhance his productivity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our aircraft policy does not permit other executives to use Company-owned aircraft for personal use without the advance approval of the Chief Executive Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No named executive officers receive tax protection on the imputed income for personal use of Company-owned aircraft.

sentences.text: Share Ownership Guidelines
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We expect all of our executive officers and certain other high-level key executives to hold a number of our shares with a value equal to a pre-determined multiple of their base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These multiples, as shown below, represent the minimum guidelines and are consistent with trends we have seen in the competitive market.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each executive must own a minimum of 20% of the required shares outright.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executives are expected to hold shares that vest and shares acquired upon the exercise of stock options until these requirements are met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, executives are expected to reach these guidelines within five years of appointment to a new position and are expected to satisfy them for the duration of their employment with the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Position    Minimum Guideline Chief Executive Officer of Eaton Corporation     6 times base salary Vice Chairman, Chief Financial and Planning Officer of Eaton Corporation     4 times base salary Chief Operating Officer Electrical or Industrial Sector of Eaton Corporation     4 times base salary Other Officers    2-3 times base salary General Managers and other ESIP participants     1 time base salary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Twice each year, the Committee reviews each executive officers share ownership relative to these levels, and our Chief Executive Officer reviews the ownership of other non-officer executives.

sentences.text: On December 31, 2016, each of the named executive officers exceeded his or her ownership and holding requirements.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Anti-Hedging and Pledging
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have a policy that prohibits directors and officers, including the named executive officers, from engaging in financial hedging of their investment risk in our shares and from pledging our shares as collateral for a loan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Clawback Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has adopted a formal policy stating that, if an executive engaged in any fraud, misconduct or other bad-faith action that, directly or indirectly, caused or partially caused the need for a material accounting restatement for any periods as to which a performance-based award was paid or credited to the executive during the 12-month period following the first public issuance of the incorrect financial statement, such award shall be subject to reduction, cancellation or reimbursement to the Company at the Boards discretion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The clawback policy covers any executive who participates in our ESIP or any successor plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our incentive compensation plans, stock plans and deferral plans all include the provisions of this policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This policy may be found on our website at http://www.eaton.com/governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tax and Accounting Considerations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We carefully monitor and comply with any changes in the laws, regulations, accounting standards and related interpretive guidance that impact our executive compensation plans and programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tax and accounting considerations have never played a central role in the process of determining the compensation or benefit plans and programs that are provided to our executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Instead, the Committee consistently has structured our executive compensation program in a manner intended to ensure that it s competitive in the marketplace for executive talent and provides incentives and rewards that focus our executives on reaching desired internal and external performance levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Once the appropriate programs and plans are identified, we administer and account for them in accordance with applicable requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: $1 Million Tax Deduction Limit  Under Internal Revenue Code Section 162(m), any remuneration in excess of $1 million paid to Mr. Arnold or any of the three most highly compensated executive officers of the Company (other than the Vice Chairman and Chief Financial and Planning Officer of Eaton Corporation) in a given year is not tax deductible unless it is paid pursuant to formula-driven, performance-based arrangements that preclude Committee discretion to adjust compensation upward after the beginning of the period in which the compensation is earned.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2013, our shareholders approved the amended and restated Senior EIC and ESIP plans, which are intended to meet the requirements to qualify incentive payments under these Plans as deductible compensation under Internal Revenue Code Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, certain performance-based share grants made from our shareholder-approved 2015 Stock Plan are also intended to meet the requirements to qualify the payments as deductible compensation under Internal Revenue Code Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN COMPENSATION PLANS AND RISK
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year, the Committee and management conduct a comprehensive review of our executive and broad-based compensation programs to determine whether any of our compensation programs, either individually or in the aggregate, would encourage employees to undertake excessive risks that are reasonably likely to have a material adverse impact on the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation and Organization Committee Annual Risk Assessment
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After reviewing an inventory of our 2016 broad-based variable pay and sales commission plans, which included the number of participants in each plan, the participants levels within the organization, the target and maximum payment potential, performance criteria under each plan, and the type of the plan (for example, management-by-objective and goal sharing), the Committee concluded that none of the broad-based programs would likely give rise to a material risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee also applied a risk assessment to the short- and long-term incentive plans that are described earlier in the CD&A.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This analysis included, but was not limited to, the following items:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whether performance goals were balanced and potential payments were reasonable based on potential achievement of those goals at the threshold, target and maximum levels;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When applicable, whether the relationship between performance objectives under the short-term incentive programs was consistent with the performance objectives tied to the long-term incentive plans;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The caps on individual awards and aggregate payments under the plans; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How our performance objectives and target award opportunities compared to the objectives and target awards underlying our peers incentive programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Executive Compensation Strategies and Programs Are Structured to Reduce Risk
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: interest of the Company and its stakeholders and do not create a material risk due to a variety of mitigating factors, such as:   An emphasis on long-term compensation that utilizes a balanced portfolio of compensation elements and delivers rewards based on sustained performance over time;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: excellence, and building organizational capacity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe all of these items contribute to increased shareholder value;   Our long-term performance plan (ESIP) focuses on cumulative EPS and CFR for overlapping multi-year award periods that began prior to 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This creates a focus on driving sustained performance over multiple award periods that mitigates the potential for executives to take excessive risks to drive one-time, short-term performance spikes in any one period;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The use of equity awards to foster retention and align our executives interests with those of our shareholders;   Capping the potential payouts under the short- and long-term incentive plans to eliminate the potential for windf
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Capping the potential payouts under the short- and long-term incentive plans to eliminate the potential for windfalls;   A clawback policy that allows us to recover compensation in the case of a material restatement of financial results and/or employee misconduct;   Share ownership guidelines; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Share ownership guidelines; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A broad array of benefit programs that offer employees and executives an opportunity to build meaningful retirement assets throughout their careers.

sentences.text: 2016 PENSION BENEFITS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We maintain three basic types of retirement income plans for our U.S. salaried employees:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a tax-qualified defined benefit pension plan (referred to as the Pension Plan for Eaton Corporation Employees in the Pension Benefits table) that has two separate benefit formulas: a final average pay formula and a cash balance formula;   two defined benefit restoration plans (collectively referred to as the DB Restoration Plan in the Pension Benefits table); and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: two defined benefit restoration plans (collectively referred to as the DB Restoration Plan in the Pension Benefits table); and   a plan that allows us to supplement the pension benefits earned under our qualified pension plan and nonqualified DB Restoration Plan to certain elected officers and executives who are recruited by us mid-career (referred to as the Limited Service Supplemental Plan in the Pension Benefits table).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tax-Qualified Retirement Income Plans  Effective January 1, 2003, employees who were then earning benefits under the Average Final Annual Compensation benefit formula (the AFAC benefit formula) under the Pension Plan for Eaton Corporation Employees (the Pension Plan) were given the option to either:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) continue earning benefits under the AFAC benefit formula, or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) convert the value of their accrued benefit to an opening balance and commence earning benefits in an Eaton Personal Pension Account under the cash balance formula (the EPPA benefit formula).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Salaried employees hired on or after January 1, 2002, but before April 1, 2013, automatically earn benefits under the EPPA benefit formula upon becoming eligible for participation in the retirement plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the AFAC benefit formula, annual normal retirement benefits are computed at the rate of 1% of average final annual compensation up to the applicable Social Security integration level plus 1.5% of average final annual compensation in excess of the Social Security integration level, multiplied by the employees years of credited service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the employee receives a supplement equal to 1/2% of average final annual compensation up to the applicable Social Security integration level payable until the Social Security Normal Retirement Age.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An employees average final annual compensation is the average annual amount of his or her eligible compensation (generally consisting of salary plus

sentences.text: short-term executive incentive compensation for service during the five consecutive years within the last 10 years of employment for which the employees total compensation was the greatest).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Years of credited service includes the number of years of employment between age 21 and retirement, subject to a maximum of 44 years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate policies require the named executive officers to retire at age 65.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the EPPA benefit formula, a participants single sum retirement benefit is accumulated throughout his or her career with us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This single sum amount is represented as a notional account balance to which credits are regularly added.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The credits are equal to a percentage of eligible compensation (generally consisting of salary and short-term incentive compensation) plus nterest at a specified rate and, where applicable, cost-of-living including credits on certain opening balances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The percentage of eligible compensation credited to the participants notional account balance varies over his or her career based on the sum of the participants age and service with us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For any period when that sum is less than 50, 5.0% of eligible compensation is credited.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For any period when the sum is between 50 and 59 (inclusive), 6.0% of eligible compensation is credited.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When the sum is between 60 and 69 (inclusive), 7.0% of eligible compensation is credited.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When the sum is 70 or greater, 8.0% of eligible compensation is credited.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Except as noted below, upon termination of employment, the notional account balance is available as a single sum or may be converted to one of several annuity forms.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the standard post-retirement surviving spouse option for the AFAC and EPPA benefit formulas, the participant receives a reduced pension, and a pension equal to 50% of the reduced pension is payable to his or her surviving spouse.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, the benefit for an employee electing that option at age 65 whose spouse is five years younger would be approximately 11.5% less than the amount of the participants annual benefit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any employee hired on or after April 1, 2013 and all U.S. employees of Cooper immediately prior to our acquisition of Cooper will receive an additional employer contribution under the Eaton Savings Plan in lieu of a benefit under the Pension Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nonqualified Defined Benefit Retirement Plans  Certain provisions of the Internal Revenue Code limit the annual benefits that may be paid from a tax-qualified retirement plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This includes a limitation on the amount of annual compensation that may be taken into account in calculating a participants benefit under a qualified retirement plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As permitted under the Internal Revenue Code, the Board of Directors has authorized the payment from our general funds of any benefits calculated under the provisions of the applicable pension plan that may exceed those limits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This applies to all participants, including the named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Limited Eaton Service Supplemental Retirement Income Plan  The Board of Directors has adopted a plan that provides supplemental annual retirement income to elected officers and certain executives who do not have the opportunity to accumulate significant credited service with us under our tax-qualified retirement income plans, provided that they either retire at age 55 or older and have at least 10 years of service with us or retire at age 65 or older regardless of the years of service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amount of the annual supplement generally is equal to the amount by which a percentage of the executives average final annual compensation exceeds his or her earned retirement income.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This includes amounts receivable under the retirement plans described above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The percentage of average final annual compensation used for this purpose depends upon an executives age and years of service at retirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The percentage ranges from 25% (for retirements at age 55 with less than 15 years of service) to 50% (for retirements at age 62 or older with 15 years or more of service).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits accrued and vested before January 1, 2005 under either the nonqualified or the limited service plans generally are paid in one of the forms available under the Pension Plans as elected by the participant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits earned after 2004 are paid as a single lump sum.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to all benefits, regardless of when accrued, the present value of the benefit will be paid in a single installment upon a change of control of the Company.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 POTENTIAL PAYMENTS UPON TERMINATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A named executive officer may experience a termination of employment under several possible situations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In each of these circumstances, certain plans, agreements, arrangements or practices would provide compensation to the executive in varying amounts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not provide employment contracts to our executives and do not have plans or arrangements (other than the Change of Control Agreements previously discussed and standard severance benefits available to all U.S. salaried, nonunion employees) that would require any payment to a named executive officer in the event of a termination of his or her employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Instead, the Compensation and Organization Committee of our Board of Directors exercises the sole discretion to decide what, if any, additional severance payments or benefits will be offered to an executive in the case of a termination of employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In exercising this discretion, the Committee takes a number of factors into consideration, including the reasons for the termination and the individual executives personal circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believes that it is in the best interest of the Company and our shareholders to insure that a departing executive is treated fairly and in a manner that will help us to secure appropriate confidentiality, non-competition, non-solicitation, non-disparagement and general release agreements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Moreover, providing fair and reasonable employment termination compensation is consistent with our overall compensation philosophy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In this section, we discuss termination of employment scenarios that include:

sentences.text: We would calculate and pay any such earned awards in accordance with the normal operation of the plans.

sentences.text: Therefore, we have not included these awards in the following scenarios because they do not represent a severance or other payment that is triggered by employment termination.

sentences.text: We maintain a Severance Benefit Plan in which each of the named executive officers participates along with all of our U.S. salaried, non-union employees.

sentences.text: We generally pay benefits under this Plan only in the case of an involuntary termination of employment other than for Cause.

sentences.text: We calculate the benefits under this plan based on the length of service with us from the most recent date of hire.

sentences.text: The maximum severance payment under this plan equals one year of base salary and continuation of health and welfare benefits for six months.

sentences.text: However, the severance payment that we would expect to provide to a named executive officer under the scenarios described below would be made in lieu of any benefit under these standard severance arrangements.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) credit for the total number of months of service with us from the start of an eligible award period through the executives termination date as a percentage of the total number of months in the award period multiplied by
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the terms of our standard form of stock option, RSA and RSU grant agreements for grants awarded prior to May 1, 2015, in the case of a change of control of the Company, vesting of all of the executives outstanding unvested equity grants would be accelerated.

sentences.text: For grants awarded after May 1, 2015, acceleration only occurs if the acquiring company does not assume or replace the grants or if the executive is terminated in connection with the change in control of the Company.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each named executive officer is subject to mandatory retirement at age 65 and is eligible to elect voluntary retirement after having attained age 55 with ten or more years of service.

sentences.text: Change of Control
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Another scenario under which a named executive officers employment may terminate is through a qualifying termination in connection with a change of control of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have entered into Change of Control Agreements with each of our officers, including the named executive officers, which provide for payments and benefits in the event of a termination of employment in the context of a change of control of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, as noted above in Background and Basic Assumptions, under the terms of our standard form of stock option, RSA and RSU grant agreements, in the case of a change of control of the Company, vesting of all of the executives outstanding unvested equity grants would be accelerated if the grants are not assumed or replaced by the acquiring company or if the executive is terminated in connection with the change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Change of Control Agreements that we have with our officers contain the following key provisions:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The agreement first becomes effective upon a change of control of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the two years following the change of control, the agreement protects the executive officer from certain changes to his o her employment, position, duties, compensation and benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If, during this two-year period, the successor company terminates the executive officers employment other than for Cause (which includes the willful and continued failure of the executive to perform his or her duties, the executives conviction of a felony involving dishonesty, or the executives willful engagement in gross misconduct which is materially and demonstrably injurious to the Company) or Disability or if the executive terminates his or her employment for Good Reason (which includes the assignment to the executive of any duties inconsistent in any respect with the executives position; failure by the Company to comply with any of the provisions of the Change of Control Agreement (other than inadvertent failure not occurring in bad faith); the Company requiring the executive to be based at any office or location that differs from what is specified in the Change of Control Agreement; or the Company requiring the Executive to travel on Company business to a substantially greater extent than was required immediately prior to the change of control), the executive would receive:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A lump sum cash payment equal to the aggregate of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) any earned but as yet unpaid base salary and short-term and long-term incentive awards (ESIP) for completed incentive award periods,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) a prorated portion of his or her target opportunity for any open ESIP award periods and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) the executives annual base salary and target incentive opportunity under the short-term plan multiplied by three;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Two years of the payment described in item (c) above represents severance payments and one year is in exchange for an agreement not to compete with the Company for a period of one year following the termination date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: b.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Continued health and welfare benefits as if the executives employment had not been terminated for a period of two years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the extent that any payments under the Change of Control Agreements are deferred compensation and the executive is  specified employee within the meaning of Internal Revenue Code Section 409A and the regulations thereunder (determined in accordance with the methodology established by us as of the date of termination of employment), such payments or other benefits will not be paid or provided before the first business day that is six months after the date of termination of employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No executives receive tax protection on payments made in connection with a change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As is common practice with such agreements, these payments and benefits would not be subject to any requirement that the officer seek other employment or any other form of mitigation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We would pay the officers legal fees if he or she needed to take action to enforce the provisions of the agreement or defend the agreements terms if contested by us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 6: Advisory Vote on the Frequency of an Advisory Vote on Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to Section 14A of the Exchange Act, we are asking shareholders to vote on whether future advisory votes on executive compensation of the nature reflected in Proposal 5 should occur every year, every two years or every three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Currently, pursuant to the shareholder advisory vote taken in connection with the 2011 Annual Meeting of our predecessor company, Eaton Corporation, shareholders vote in an advisory capacity on executive compensation annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After careful consideration, our Board of Directors has determined that an advisory vote on executive compensation that occurs every year remains the most appropriate alternative for our Company, and therefore our Board of Directors unanimously recommends that you vote for a one-year interval in this regard.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company and the Board continue to feel that an annual advisory vote on executive compensation will be most effective as it will foster frequent, ongoing engagement and dialog between our Board and our constituents.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the Companys executive compensation programs are designed to promote a long-term connection between pay and performance, the Board of Directors recognizes that executive compensation disclosures are made annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board welcomes shareholder input, each year, on our compensation philosophy, policies and practices as disclosed annually in our proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may cast your vote on your preferred voting frequency by choosing the option of one year, two years, three years or you may abstain from voting when you vote in response to the resolution set forth below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED, that the option of once every one year, two years, or three years that receives the highest number of votes cast for this resolution will be determined to be the advisory vote result regarding the frequency with which the Company is to hold a shareholder vote to approve the compensation of the Named Executive Officers as disclosed in the proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The option of one year, two years or three years that receives the highest number of votes cast by shareholders will be the frequency for the advisory vote on executive compensation that has been selected by shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, because this vote is advisory and not binding on the Board of Directors or the Company, the Board may decide that it is in the best interests of our shareholders and the Company to hold an advisory vote on executive compensation more or less frequently than the option approved by our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors recommends that you vote to conduct future advisory votes on executive compensation every year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
